meanings.definition: relating to the earliest stage of development
meanings.sent1: The germinal idea for the project was just beginning to form in his mind.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the germinal cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The germinal concept of a flying car seemed far-fetched at first.
meanings.sent4: Her germinal talent for painting blossomed into a successful career.
meanings.sent5: The germinal stage of the plant's growth was crucial for its future health.

meanings.definition: giving rise to new developments; creative
meanings.sent1: His germinal approach to problem-solving always led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent2: The artist's germinal style inspired many young painters.
meanings.sent3: The germinal idea for a new invention struck him in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: Her germinal imagination knew no bounds when it came to storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The germinal spark of creativity ignited a wave of inspiration in the room.

meanings.definition: containing the seeds of future development
meanings.sent1: The germinal document laid out the foundation for future policies.
meanings.sent2: The meeting was a germinal moment for the company's growth strategy.
meanings.sent3: The germinal decision to expand the business was met with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: His germinal idea for a new product line revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent5: The germinal conversation planted the seeds for a fruitful partnership.
